title: Ticket #4067: Debian packaging installs files owned by uid 1011
description:
(From LIGO:)

The package installs /etc/init.d/condor, /etc/condor (and its contents), and /usr/bin/condor.* with ownership of uid/gid of 1011. That doesn't map to condor:condor on my system and the package management doesn't enforce that mapping - it might successfully enforce the mapping if the condor:condor user/group doesn't exist before the package is installed and uid/gid 1011:1011 is unclaimed. On a system where 1011:1011 Condor installs A-OK if 1011:1011 happens to be some random user.

I also don't see why those directories/files need to be writable by condor/condor. Readable, sure. I just have CFEngine chown everything Condor installs to root:root and ensure global readability.
remarks:
Also happening at CAE. 8.0.5 has 1003 for the uid/gid.
